page.title: 04HOUSES
page.content: {Northowram}and{Sibden}contain many old houses, going back as far as the 15th century. Most of the old houses were farms or tradesmens houses. They were all built out of the local stone, known as{Yorkshire Sandstone,}which is still quaried in the area. In the 19th century many cottages were built to house the mill workers. They were again built out of local sandstone and many are still standing today, especially near where the old mills useed to be. Most modern houses are made of concrete blocks or bricks and because the{Shibden Valley}is a conservation area there is no new building. In{Northowram}there are several "new estates". Of the 18 children in our class one lives in Staups Hall,2 live in farms, 6 live in old cottages and 9 in houses built since 1945.
